meanings.definition: Extremely close or constricted in a tight manner.
meanings.sent1: The jar lid was supertight, making it hard to open.
meanings.sent2: The rope was supertight around the package, keeping it secure.
meanings.sent3: The supertight hug from the little girl almost squeezed the air out of me.
meanings.sent4: The supertight grip of fear held him in its grasp.
meanings.sent5: The supertight knot was impossible to untangle.

meanings.definition: Very strict or stringent in control or management.
meanings.sent1: The teacher had a supertight rule about no talking during exams.
meanings.sent2: The company had a supertight policy on data protection.
meanings.sent3: The supertight schedule left no room for delays.
meanings.sent4: The supertight regulations ensured safety for all.
meanings.sent5: The supertight supervision kept everything in order.

meanings.definition: Very secure or difficult to penetrate or escape from.
meanings.sent1: The fortress had supertight security to prevent any breaches.
meanings.sent2: The safe was supertight, protecting its contents from theft.
meanings.sent3: The supertight lock kept the treasure hidden away.
meanings.sent4: The supertight grip of the handcuffs made escape impossible.
meanings.sent5: The supertight seal on the container preserved its freshness.
